name: Tanzania
introduction: Shortly after achieving independence from Britain in the early 1960s Tanganyika and Zanzibar merged to form the United Republic of Tanzania in 1964. One-party rule ended in 1995 with the first democratic elections held in the country since the 1970s. Zanzibar's semi-autonomous status and popular opposition led to two contentious elections since 1995 which the ruling party won despite international observers' claims of voting irregularities. The formation of a government of national unity between Zanzibar's two leading parties succeeded in minimizing electoral tension in 2010.
overview: Tanzania is an East African country known for its vast wilderness areas. They include the plains of Serengeti National Park a safari mecca populated by the “big five” game (elephant lion leopard buffalo rhino) and Kilimanjaro National Park home to Africa’s highest mountain. Offshore lie the tropical islands of Zanzibar with Arabic influences and Mafia with a marine park home to whale sharks and coral reefs.

languages.name: Aasáx
languages.area: North, central Maasai Steppe, Landenai, Ndovu Okutu, Lolbeni villages. Also reportedly in Lemelebo, Landrobo, Naitomani districts.

languages.name: Omani Arabic
languages.area: Mainly in Hajar Mountains highlands; a few coastal regions. Also in Djibouti, Kenya, Tanzania, United Arab Emirates.

languages.name: Arabic
languages.area: Middle East, North Africa. Also in Algeria, Bahrain, Chad, Comoros, Djibouti, Egypt, Eritrea, Iraq, Israel, Jordan, Kuwait, Lebanon, Libya, Morocco, Oman, Palestinian West Bank and Gaza, Qatar, Somalia, Sudan, Syria, Tanzania, Tunisia, United Arab Emirates, Yemen.

languages.name: Asu (Tanzania)
languages.area: Northeast, Kilimanjaro region, Pare Mountains, Mwanga and Same districts.

languages.name: Bende
languages.area: Rukwa region, Mpanda District, Kabungu, Karema, and Mwese divisions.

languages.name: Burunge
languages.area: Dodoma region, Kondoa District, southeast of Langi [lag], Goima, Chambalo, and Mirambu villages.

languages.name: Bemba (Zambia)
languages.area: North, Copperbelt, and Luapula provinces. Also in Botswana, Democratic Republic of the Congo, Malawi.

languages.name: Bena (Tanzania)
languages.area: Southwest central, Iringa region, Njombe District.

languages.name: Bembe

languages.name: Bondei

languages.name: Cutchi-Swahili

languages.name: Mandarin Chinese
languages.area: Widespread north of Changjiang River, a belt south of the Changjiang from Qiujiang (Jiangxi) to Zhenjiang (Jiangsu), Hubei, except southeast corner, Sichuan, Yunnan, Guizhou, northwest part of Guangxi, and northwest corner of Hunan. Also in Brunei, Cambodia, Canada, Indonesia (Java and Bali), Laos, Libya, Malaysia (Peninsular), Mauritius, Mongolia, Mozambique, Philippines, Russian Federation (Asia), Singapore, Taiwan, Thailand, United Kingdom, United States, Viet Nam, Zambia.

languages.name: Kabwa

languages.name: Kwere

languages.name: Taita

languages.name: German
languages.area: Also in Argentina, Australia, Austria, Belgium, Bolivia, Bosnia and Herzegovina, Brazil, Canada, Chile, Croatia, Czech Republic, Denmark, Ecuador, Estonia, Finland, France, Hungary, Israel, Italy, Kazakhstan, Kyrgyzstan, Liechtenstein, Luxembourg, Moldova, Mozambique, Namibia, Paraguay, Philippines, Poland, Puerto Rico, Romania, Russian Federation (Europe), Slovakia, Slovenia, South Africa, Switzerland, Tajikistan, Ukraine, United Arab Emirates, United States, Uruguay, Uzbekistan.

languages.name: Dhaiso

languages.name: Digo

languages.name: Ndendeule

languages.name: Doe

languages.name: Modern Greek (1453-)
languages.area: Widespread, especially in Greek Macedonia. Also in Albania, Armenia, Australia, Austria, Bahamas, Bulgaria, Canada, Congo, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Democratic Republic of the Congo, Djibouti, Egypt, France, Georgia, Germany, Hungary, Italy, Jordan, Kazakhstan, Libya, Macedonia, Malawi, Mozambique, Paraguay, Poland, Romania, Russian Federation (Europe), Sierra Leone, South Africa, Sweden, Tunisia, Turkey (Europe), Ukraine, United Arab Emirates, United Kingdom, United States.

languages.name: Fipa

languages.name: French

languages.name: Hindi

Also in Bangladesh, Belize, Bhutan, Botswana, Canada, Djibouti, Germany, Kenya, Nepal, New Zealand, Philippines, Singapore, South Africa, Uganda, United Arab Emirates, United Kingdom, United States, Yemen, Zambia.

languages.name: Portuguese

languages.name: Temi

languages.name: Sukuma

languages.name: Sumbwa

languages.name: Swahili
languages.description: See Coastal (SWH) Swahili or Congo (SWC) Swahili

languages.name: Tongwe
languages.area: Kigoma District, Kigoma region, Lake Tanganyika east shore, between Ilagala village north, and Kashagulu south; Kigoma and Rukwa regions boundary, east; Lake Tanganyika west shore; Small groups (20%- 30% of the population) in Uvinza and Nguruka villages.

languages.name: Taveta
languages.area: Coast Province, Taita District, Taveta area; Tanzania.

languages.name: Vidunda
languages.area: East central, south of Mikumi town, Kidodi mountains west, west of Kutu Morogoro region, east of Hehe [heh].

languages.name: Vinza
languages.area: Kigoma region, Kigoma Rural District, Uvinza town area west. West of Nyamwezi [nym], north of Tongwe [tny].

languages.name: Vunjo
languages.area: Kilimanjaro region, Chagga area.

languages.name: Wanda
languages.area: Mbeya region, Mbozi District; Rukwa region, Sumbawanga Rural District.

languages.name: Vwanji
languages.area: Iringa region, Makete District, Kipengere Mountain Range. West of Bena [bez], south of Sangu [sbp], north of Kinga [zga].

languages.name: Alagwa
languages.area: Dodoma region, Kondoa District.

languages.name: Kw'adza
languages.area: Manyara region, Mbulu District.

languages.name: Bungu
languages.area: Mbeya region, Chunya District.

languages.name: Soga

languages.name: Subi
languages.area: Kagera region, Biharamulo District.

languages.name: Yao
languages.area: Southeast tip of Lake Malawi area, bordering Mozambique. Also in Mozambique, Tanzania, Zambia.

languages.name: Makwe
languages.area: Cabo Delgado Province coast, Tanzania border south to Quionga, Palma, to just south of Olumbe; interior along Ruvuma River to Pundanhar. Also in Tanzania.

languages.name: Yue Chinese
languages.area: Guangdong (except Hakka speaking areas northeast, Min Nan-speaking areas east, Hainan Island); Guangxi. Hong Kong and Macau. Also in Australia, Brunei, Canada, Costa Rica, Honduras, Indonesia (Java and Bali), Malaysia (Peninsular), Mauritius, Nauru, Netherlands, New Zealand, Panama, Philippines, Singapore, South Africa, Thailand, United Kingdom, United States, Viet Nam.

languages.name: Yulu
languages.area: Ouadda-Djaléi and Ouadda subprefectures. Yulu are in Central African Republic and Sudan; Binga are in Sudan and Democratic Republic of the Congo. Also in Democratic Republic of the Congo, Sudan.

languages.name: Zaramo
languages.area: East central coast, Pwani region, Kisarawe and Bagamoyo districts, between Bagamoyo and Dar es Salaam.

languages.name: Zanaki

languages.name: Kinga
languages.area: Iringa region, Makete District, Kipengere Mountain Range.

languages.name: Zinza

languages.name: Zigula
languages.area: Pwani region, Bagamoyo District; Tanga region northeast, Maasai Steppe.
